page.title: 01Coastal Strip N Of Silecroft
page.content: The designated area is mostly sea & includes the shore north of Silecroft. Quarter of a mile of sand at low tide, then a shingle beach backed by low cliffs. The cliffs are continually washing down onto the beach, and farmers have to re-site boundary fences frequently, to prevent animals straying. The fields on the coastal plain are generally stocked with cattle and sheep, but on some barley and turnips are grown in rotation. In 1985 because of very heavy & continuous rainfall, very little hay was taken in. Summerhill is occupied, but new buildings lived in up to 1940, are now cattle shelters. The west Cumbria railway (NE square) is still in use & power lines parrallel the railway line. A wholly agricultural area.
